meanings.definition: To act as an impartial judge in a dispute
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to arbitrate the argument between the students.
meanings.sent2: The court appointed a neutral party to arbitrate the case.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl was asked to arbitrate the debate between the squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The calm lake seemed to arbitrate the quarrel between the two ducks.
meanings.sent5: The golden retriever's wagging tail arbitrated the tension in the room.

meanings.definition: To settle a disagreement between two parties
meanings.sent1: The manager had to arbitrate the conflict between the employees.
meanings.sent2: The couple sought a counselor to arbitrate their marital issues.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot was called upon to arbitrate the argument between the cats.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to arbitrate the disagreement between the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow's colors arbitrated a truce between the rain and the sun.

meanings.definition: To mediate or negotiate a resolution
meanings.sent1: The diplomat was able to arbitrate a peace treaty between the two nations.
meanings.sent2: The union representative helped arbitrate the labor dispute.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was asked to arbitrate the deal between the rabbits.
meanings.sent4: The flowing river seemed to arbitrate a compromise between the rocks.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers arbitrated a solution to the garden conflict.
